description: Performance figures showing how many people use the Tube, how trains are performing, etc.

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["London Underground conducts surveys that count the number of people using our service, where they travel to and from and how long their journeys last. We also monitor performance and assets, measuring how far trains have travelled and how many trains, lifts and escalators are in service."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Most of our regular performance figures are updated every four weeks - defined as a period - and show a range of service and network-related matters. Some measures are updated once a quarter.

{"template":"table","titles":["Passenger journeys","Customer satisfaction","Excess journey time"],"rows":[["117.39 million",""],["\u003cstrong\u003eLost customer hours\u003c/strong\u003e ","4.9 million",""],["83 (Q2)",""],["6.48 minutes",""]]}

We regularly report to the Rail & Underground Panel on our performance against other metros around the world.
